name: Swoop
description:
Swoop is a one-stop shop for businesses seeking finance. Our user-friendly tech platform simplifies and speeds up access to loans, grants and equity funding across Ireland and the UK. We integrate with multiple data sources to help our customers build their business profile quickly and be instantly matched to funding. Our customers also have their own financial dashboard to keep up to date on their financial and liquidity metrics and we alert them when they become eligible for new funds or savings. Once we match to the right funding or saving we manage the application process so that our customers can focus on building their business. Customers range from start-up business to larger corporates requiring capital.

Swoop wants to take the pain out of raising finance and saving finance for business owners and financial advisors. Our SMEs are time poor, so we need to design systems and journeys that seem effortless and intuitive, so that they can spend more time managing their businesses.

jobs.title: Backend Engineer
jobs.description:
[Swoop](https://swoopfunding.com/) is a marketplace platform connecting SMEs (small to medium enterprises) to funding solutions and financial savings. Swoop takes the pain out of raising finance and saving finance for business owners and financial advisors. No more painful blind research, no more arduous application forms and no more black holes of information. Swoop leverages an SMEs core data points and financial information to help business owners understand the funding landscape and discover the best funding and saving options for them.

We design systems and journeys that are effortless and intuitive, so that our users can spend more time on what they want to do – managing their business.

Some links to find out more about Swoop:

- Andrea’s (our CEO) recent interview for Capital Conversations: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=21aGJB_gScQ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=21aGJB_gScQ) 
- Information behind our funding from the UK’s Banking Competition Remedies (BCR): [https://swoopfunding.com/blog/swoop-receives-5-million-funding-from-bcr/](https://swoopfunding.com/blog/swoop-receives-5-million-funding-from-bcr/) 
- An article about Andrea and Swoop in The Sunday Times:

[https://swoopfunding.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/10398-STim_SwoopFunding_25082019-A.pdf](https://swoopfunding.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/10398-STim_SwoopFunding_25082019-A.pdf)

**Requirements**

Swoop engineers get challenging problems to work on from day one. These include complex matching algorithms, transaction processing, creating scalable APIs to building new micro services. We work with data and want to provide to SMEs the best decisions and recommendations based on their profiles and specific details. You'll also be involved in making our processes data driven and using latest technologies and innovation in data processing, machine learning and AI. We are flexible and choose the best tools for the job. We have loads of exciting features in the pipeline and are looking for ambitious engineers to build the best marketplace platform in finance.

This role is available in London, Barcelona or fully remote.

**A bit about you:**

- You have 2+ years experience in backend Python development and keen to learn new tech
- You're passionate about user experience - empathy with customers drives your decisions
- You have good system design skills
- You hold yourself to high coding standards (TDD, Clean Code)
- You consider automated tests a must
- You have hands-on experience with SQL and no-SQL datastores
- You have hands-on experience with messaging and event driven infrastructure 
- You have experience with API development and Swagger/OpenAPI specifications
- You understand and have experience using cloud infrastructure
- You are self-motivated and able to work well as part of a distributed engineering team.

**Bonus points:**

- You have strong system design skills and experience building products with scale and performance in mind
- Experience with Javascript (React) or Terraform
- You understand and have experience using OAuth2.0 or OpenID
- Experience with GraphQL, GRPC
- Tools: Github, Docker, Kubernetes
- Datastores: PostgresQL, MS SQLServer
- Messaging: RabbitMQ, Kafka
- Practitioner level with GCP or Azure
- Experience with Web Analytics tools like Google Analytics and Amplitude
- Financial services and/or Open banking API experience
- Knowledge of SME funding options (loans, equity, grants)

**Benefits**

- Enjoy a competitive salary
- 25 days holiday per year
- All the latest tech you need
- Pension plan
- A lovely, spacious, natural light filled office in Fitzrovia
- Learn how an exciting business that’s disrupting an industry is scaling up
- Have ownership of your work and enjoy the impact you create
- Have a say in how the business evolves and scales within a start-up environment
- Get to work with some other excellent, like-minded experts
- Work within a transparent, friendly and collaborative culture
- Limitless challenge and scope for development. You are joining us at a very exciting time and have the opportunity to take this role in your preferred direction as we grow
- Flexible working where possible.

jobs.title: Community Manager
jobs.description:
Swoop is an exciting, fast-growing FinTech platform connecting SMEs to funding solutions and financial savings, taking the pain out of financing for SMEs. No more painful blind research, no more arduous application forms and no more black holes of information. Swoop leverages SME’s core data points and financial information to help business owners understand the funding landscape and uncover the best funding and saving options for them.



We’re thrilled to be growing our team across our London and Dublin offices, and investing in taking our platform to new heights by making it accessible and available to all SMEs across UK, Ireland and beyond.



Job Description

We’re expanding our London-based marketing team and seeking a Partner Marketing Manager to develop and deliver a plan to drive awareness and demand generation activities within our Partner and Customer Community networks.

Our Partner network consists of professional membership organisations, accelerator/growth hubs, banks, providers, and large accountancy firms and groups who each have their own network of SMEs, and therefore require specific and sometimes bespoke marketing efforts. Our own Community consists of the CEOs and founders of our customers.

This will be a role that will involve you working closely with our partners to ultimately drive revenue to our business via their own networks. This will be achieved by ensuring they have all the content and tools they need to make this happen – and also ensuring the campaign execution is there to enable it.



You will be responsible for delivering a strategy which builds growth within our existing partner network through demand generation, co-marketing campaigns and proposition development. You’ll be responsible for effective marketing programmes including managing the regular delivery of content, webinars, workshops, events, training/education of partners’ communities, as well as budget management and ROI tracking and evaluation. You will take control of planning and executing fully integrated campaigns to drive overall demand of the Swoop platform.

Desired Skills & Experience

Ideally you will have had solid exposure in a similar Partner Marketing or Alliance type role, and FinTech or financial services exposure would be ideal. Experience working on co-marketing campaigns would also be a big advantage.

About you

ou are an experienced marketer, ideally in financial services with three or more years of experience in a B2B marketing role.
You have a proven track record of driving growth through partnerships.
You will enjoy working in a small, start-up culture with a “sleeves-rolled up” approach to getting involved in all areas of the business and brand building.
Excellent copy-writing ability with strong attention to detail and accuracy.
You have experience in building brand identity and driving sales through digital channels, and also face to face and direct marketing initiatives
You have a customer-focused mindset, ensuring the delivery of quality output on time and to budget.
A self-starter, able to work under pressure and tight deadlines.
Creative, but commercially-minded.
You have a mix of creative and analytical skills - able to develop new innovative marketing activities with strong quantitative analytical skills to review and act on the results
You are able to work across multiple teams both internally and externally.
Although this role would ideally suit someone with B2B experience in a Fintech company, our team come from a variety of backgrounds and we welcome diversity – if you’re unsure, please apply.





Why Join Swoop?

Learn how an exciting business that’s disrupting an industry is scaling up
Have a say in how the business evolves and scales within a start-up environment
Get to work with other excellent, like-minded experts
Enjoy a transparent, friendly and collaborative culture
Limitless challenge and scope for development. You are joining us at a very exciting time and have the opportunity to take this role in your preferred direction as we grow
Flexible working where possible
So, if you you’re hungry to succeed within one of the most admired and respected new FinTech businesses of today, we want to hear about it. Interested applicants can send their CV and cover letter to careers@swoopfunding.com with the job title in the subject header.

jobs.title: Digital Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
Swoop is an exciting, fast-growing FinTech platform connecting SMEs to funding solutions and financial savings, taking the pain out of financing for SMEs. No more painful blind research, no more arduous application forms and no more black holes of information. Swoop leverages SME’s core data points and financial information to help business owners understand the funding landscape and uncover the best funding and saving options for them.

We’re thrilled to be growing our team across our London and Dublin offices, and investing in taking our platform to new heights by making it accessible and available to all SMEs across UK, Ireland and beyond.

Job Description

We’re expanding our London-based marketing team and seeking an experienced and dynamic Digital Marketing Manager to drive web, social and digital channels as part of the full marketing mix.

We’re seeking somebody who is passionate about customer acquisition, funnel conversion, customer activation and retention. We require skills whereby digital and social marketing are second nature and making data-driven content and campaign decisions are what drives you.

The role will entail generating qualified traffic via paid/organic search marketing, social media, SEO, affiliates, email, and display with the ultimate goal of driving qualified conversions.

Working within the marketing team, you will collaborate closely with the product, design, data and sales teams to conceive, manage, analyse, and optimise campaigns that drive customer growth and funnel improvements.

Responsibilities & Duties

Drive customer acquisition through a diverse range of digital channels – maintaining and constantly optimising for maximum impact
Generate data-driven hypotheses and execute experiments throughout the ‘acquisition, activation, retention, revenue, referral’ funnel – identifying insights and key opportunities for improvement
Generate broad awareness and drive targeted traffic through extensive social media activity and campaigning
Grow organic traffic generation through effective SEO strategies
Oversee and constantly optimise paid-for traffic generation
Work with the partnership team to optimise affiliate/referral traffic
Curate digital sales, social, and marketing collateral, maintaining brand consistency and alignment with wider activity
Work with wider marketing team to interpret broader mission-led PR and brand campaigns into online opportunities
Research and advise on external technology-driven marketing initiatives focusing on customer acquisition
Optimise web analytics and business intelligence tools to better understand our customers and exploit those insights in marketing campaigns
Collaborate with internal teams and external agencies to evaluate and optimise our growth strategy and ultimate performance
Manage budgets and report on digital campaign ROI and CAC.
About you

In an ideal world, you are an experienced digital marketer, ideally in financial services with three or more years of experience in a B2B marketing role.
Proven experience in growth or acquisition marketing, with a track record of planning and executing customer acquisition strategies across the entire marketing mix of owned, earned, and paid channels.
Well-versed in all digital marketing tactics, including SEO, SEM, email marketing, content marketing, display, etc.
You will have experience in building brand identity through LinkedIn, Twitter, Website CMS and CRM.
Experience designing and executing on A/B and multivariate user tests.
In-depth experience working with digital analytics tools
You have a mix of creative and analytical skills – able to develop new innovative marketing activities with strong quantitative analytical skills to review and act on the results
Strong communication skills both written and verbal
You will enjoy working in a small, start-up culture with a “sleeves-rolled up” approach to getting involved in all areas of the business
You are able to work across multiple teams both internally and externally.
A self-starter, able to work under pressure and tight deadlines

Why Join Swoop?

Learn how an exciting business that’s disrupting an industry is scaling up
Have a say in how the business evolves and scales within a start-up environment
Get to work with other excellent, like-minded experts
Enjoy a transparent, friendly and collaborative culture
Limitless challenge and scope for development. You are joining us at a very exciting time and have the opportunity to take this role in your preferred direction as we grow
Flexible working where possible

So, if you’re hungry to succeed within one of the most admired and respected new FinTech businesses of today, we want to hear about it.  Interested applicants can send their CV and cover letter to careers@swoopfunding.com with the job title in the subject header.

jobs.title: Sales Account Manager
jobs.description:
Swoop is an exciting, fast-growing FinTech platform connecting SMEs to funding solutions and financial savings, taking the pain out of financing for SMEs. No more painful blind research, no more arduous application forms and no more black holes of information. Swoop leverages SME’s core data points and financial information to help business owners understand the funding landscape and uncover the best funding and saving options for them.

We’re thrilled to be growing our team across our London and Dublin offices, and investing in taking our platform to new heights by making it accessible and available to all SMEs across UK, Ireland and beyond.

Job Description

Account Managers (AMs) are responsible for building excellent relationships with customers (people who require finance for their business), suppliers (organisations that supply the item a customer needs to grow their business) and lenders (organisations that provide finance, in a variety of products to customers).

Sales are responsible for delivering new business and upselling on existing accounts.  Sales must take ownership of the entire sales process; from prospecting through to negotiating and closing.

We’re on the lookout for someone who is first and foremost passionate about small businesses and loves seeing them grow and succeed. We’re looking for someone to make their mark on the UK SME funding landscape through driving significant deal flow through Swoop’s funding and savings platform.

You’ll have a passion for sales, an eye for a deal and a delight for data.

Responsibilities & Duties:

Generate sales
Generate leads through research and prospecting
Respond to inbound enquiries
Build, maintain and refine SalesForce to support client, supplier and lender relationships
Provide accurate statistics on performance
Complete administrative paperwork to support the client, supplier and lender
Maintain currency with all relevant regulatory and compliance requirements
Maintain skills through active participation with training and coaching sessions
About You:

Ideally has some sort of sales exposure
Problem Solver
Interpret Data and Information
Strong Communication Skills
Tech Literate e.g. Microsoft Office 365, GSuite Products e.g. Gmail, Google Docs etc CRM Software
Basic numeracy skills, particularly working out percentages
Ambitious and hungry to learn and earn money
Open minded to learning and a self improver
Positive Mindset
Understanding of the SME lending industry and the wider funding landscape across equity and grants
Understanding of SME financial products such as FX, banking and insurance
Swoop Opportunity:

SwoopFunding.com launched in May 2018 and is now live across the UK & Ireland offering SMEs and SME Advisor a broad range of funding and savings solutions including loads, equity, grants, banking, insurance, FX, utilities, deposits and broadband.

Since launching Swoop has grown its team and volumes significantly and has recently won NESTA’s open banking challenge for its open banking technology and was a recipient of the BCR’s Capability & Innovation Fund to improve the SME banking landscape in the UK.

Swoop has over a 1000 funding and savings providers on its platform including HSBC, RBS, Barclays, IWOCA, Growth Street, Funding Circle, TransferWise, Hiscox, Lloyds amongst others.

Swoop will give this candidate the ability to cross-sell some of the UK’s most well known funding and savings products to our SME audience.

Swoop can offer both a competitive salary and commission structure for the Sales Account Manager position that rewards growing volumes, personal performance and team performance.

Why Join Swoop?

Learn how an exciting business that’s disrupting an industry is scaling up
Have a say in how the business evolves and scales within a start-up environment
Get to work with other excellent, like-minded experts
Enjoy a transparent, friendly and collaborative culture
Limitless challenge and scope for development. You are joining us at a very exciting time and have the opportunity to take this role in your preferred direction as we grow
Flexible working where possible
So, if you’re hungry to succeed within one of the most admired and respected new FinTech businesses of today, we want to hear about it.  Interested applicants can send their CV and cover letter to careers@swoopfunding.com with the job title in the subject header.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.description:
[Swoop](https://swoop-funding.com) is a marketplace platform connecting SMEs (small to medium enterprises) to funding solutions and financial savings. Swoop takes the pain out of raising finance and saving finance for business owners and financial advisors. No more painful blind research, no more arduous application forms and no more black holes of information. Swoop leverages an SMEs core data points and financial information to help business owners understand the funding landscape and discover the best funding and saving options for them.

We design systems and journeys that are effortless and intuitive, so that our users can spend more time on what they want to do – managing their business.

Some links to find out more about Swoop:

- Andrea’s (our CEO) recent interview for Capital Conversations: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=21aGJB_gScQ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=21aGJB_gScQ) 
- Information behind our funding from the UK’s Banking Competition Remedies (BCR): [https://swoopfunding.com/blog/swoop-receives-5-million-funding-from-bcr/](https://swoopfunding.com/blog/swoop-receives-5-million-funding-from-bcr/) 
- An article about Andrea and Swoop in The Sunday Times:

[https://swoopfunding.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/10398-STim_SwoopFunding_25082019-A.pdf](https://swoopfunding.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/10398-STim_SwoopFunding_25082019-A.pdf)

**Requirements**

Swoop engineers get challenging problems to work on from day one. These include complex matching algorithms, transaction processing, creating scalable APIs to building new micro services. We work with data and want to provide to SMEs the best decisions and recommendations based on their profiles and specific details. You'll also be involved in making our processes data driven and using latest technologies and innovation in data processing, machine learning and AI. We are flexible and choose the best tools for the job. We have loads of exciting features in the pipeline and are looking for ambitious engineers to build the best marketplace platform in finance.

This role is available in London, Barcelona or fully remote.

**A bit about you:**

- You have 4 years (or above) experience in backend Python development and keen to learn new tech
- You're passionate about user experience - empathy with customers drives your decisions
- You have strong system design skills and experience building products with scale and performance in mind
- You hold yourself to high coding standards (TDD, Clean Code)
- You consider automated tests a must
- You have hands-on experience with SQL and no-SQL datastores
- You have hands-on experience with messaging and event driven infrastructure 
- You have experience with API development and Swagger specifications
- You understand and have experience using OAuth2.0 or OpenID
- You understand and have experience using cloud infrastructure
- You are self-motivated with proven ability to work well as part of a distributed engineering team.

**Bonus points:**

- Experience with C#, Javascript (React or Vue) and Terraform
- Experience with GraphQL, GRPC
- Tools: Github, Docker, Kubernetes
- Datastores: PostgresQL, MS SQLServer
- Messaging: RabbitMQ, Kafka
- Practitioner level with GCP or Azure
- Experience with Web Analytics tools like Google Analytics and Amplitude
- Financial services and/or Open banking API experience
- Knowledge of SME funding options (loans, equity, grants)

**Benefits**

- Enjoy a competitive salary
- 25 days holiday per year
- All the latest tech you need
- Pension plan
- A lovely, spacious, natural light filled office in Fitzrovia
- Learn how an exciting business that’s disrupting an industry is scaling up
- Have ownership of your work and enjoy the impact you create
- Have a say in how the business evolves and scales within a start-up environment
- Get to work with some other excellent, like-minded experts
- Work within a transparent, friendly and collaborative culture
- Limitless challenge and scope for development. You are joining us at a very exciting time and have the opportunity to take this role in your preferred direction as we grow
- Flexible working where possible.
